name: TheAtlantic
text: "Teachers signed up to be a positive adult presence in children’s lives, and to help them grow up with their peers, at school, away from home. We need them to follow through, even though it’s a challenge," Kristen McConnell writes: https://t.co/HJPB8WaLPQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to Senator Chris Coons discuss a Civilian Conservation Corps for the pandemic era on the "Social Distance" podcast. https://t.co/ob0g1S0Bji

name: TheAtlantic
text: Los Angeles has an ambitious program to use tree-planting as an axis to connect job-creation, climate sustainability, urban renewal, and economic equity and inclusion, @JamesFallows writes: https://t.co/RH0TqAWoJT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
One year ago, India revoked Kashmir’s autonomous status, throwing the region into lockdown.

“It wasn’t always a bad relationship with the army,” a young Kashmiri told @anchalvohra last fall. “Now I see them as an enemy." https://t.co/S6QY5kmmwG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump has revealed the depths of the country’s prejudice and forced Americans to reckon with a racist system, writes @DrIbram: https://t.co/glTmzZl3Xe

name: TheAtlantic
text: “For the first time in a long time, I don’t think it really makes sense for me to have children; the future is too uncertain and the current environment too unsafe,” writes @TheSamhita: https://t.co/LPbqEEhDte

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JaniceWolly: Why have one powerful cover story per issue when you can have two? Here’s the second for September, and it’s well worth your time: https://t.co/hK0dehRFI2

name: TheAtlantic
text: The human immune system is very complicated. (No, seriously, it's really very complicated.) And it's the key to answering some of the most pressing questions about how the pandemic will play out over the next months and years, @edyong209 writes: https://t.co/8lhBuwaw7M

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As every experienced federal prosecutor would immediately understand, Barr’s position violates Department of Justice lawyers’ training, their obligations to the court ... and the equal application of the law to all," @AWeissmann_ writes: https://t.co/6YAgeHqmfm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A great many people seem to think Trader José is just a little joke, rather than a bark of white supremacy," @JohnHMcWhorter writes: https://t.co/CHdoZ8V2bt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Should Joe Biden overcome these obstacles, as well as Trump’s inevitable attempts to cheat, and win the presidency, he simply must devote his political capital to tackling the process issues that eluded the last Democratic president," @SaradaPeri writes: https://t.co/LRxQDPUCX0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Throughout the pandemic, experts have recommended socializing outdoors. So what happens in the winter? @jpinsk reports: https://t.co/2gRXTbDzVy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump walked back a threat to ban TikTok over national-security concerns. Here are two big stories from our writers to help contextualize this latest back-and-forth. The Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/LlPQcMeNZm

name: TheAtlantic
text: 1/ As the presumptive Democratic nominee, Joe Biden has been urged to name his future appointees in order to cast himself as the convener of a generational transition in national leadership, @RonBrownstein reports: https://t.co/kjHlU0D5NU

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2/ If Biden wins in November, one appointee—his vice president—is likely to wield a level of influence over American politics never before seen by other modern veeps, @realcpaz reports: https://t.co/uj66SWJjAU

name: TheAtlantic
text: 3/ Biden committed to choosing a woman as his running mate in March and is expected to announce his pick this week.… https://t.co/yeBj85PkkR

name: TheAtlantic
text: 4/ Kamala Harris: The senator from California seems like the obvious choice to be Biden’s running mate. So why is she keeping mum about her own thinking? https://t.co/87s2Bg4X66

name: TheAtlantic
text: 5/ Karen Bass: The California representative’s low-key manner and progressive credentials could strengthen Biden’s campaign when he needs it most. https://t.co/dmxVjKdYKs

name: TheAtlantic
text: 6/ Susan Rice: The former national security adviser has a powerful backer and an array of experiences that complement Biden’s. https://t.co/GSL4qRDFlI

name: TheAtlantic
text: 7/ @IsaacDovere also weighs in on a few of the less-talked about contenders:

name: TheAtlantic
text: 8/ Elizabeth Warren: After ending her bid for the presidency, the senator from Massachusetts is making a case for herself as Biden’s vice president. https://t.co/Qg3bY8WvUb

name: TheAtlantic
text: 9/ Stacey Abrams: The voting-rights activist who ran for governor of Georgia in 2018 is leading an unconventional campaign to persuade the Biden camp to pick her as his running mate. https://t.co/kwy7GV7HNR

name: TheAtlantic
text: 10/ Tammy Duckworth: The Illinois senator and Purple Heart recipient is looking to leverage her military experience into a big promotion. https://t.co/dfV8pLVZIx

name: TheAtlantic
text: 11/ For more on the 2020 race, subscribe to “The Ticket,” a podcast hosted by Dovere as he reports from around the country on the politics, policies, and personalities that define this crucial moment in American history: https://t.co/YkCkfcfDv6

name: TheAtlantic
text:
How did it come to this? In our September co-cover stories, @EdYong209 and @DrIbram explore why the pandemic brought America to its knees, and the power of America's denial of racism, respectively.

Read Yong's: https://t.co/mjbYndw0IM
And Kendi's: https://t.co/yk5gz40gSM https://t.co/jBM3dXB9dn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump has revealed the depths of the country’s prejudice and forced Americans to reckon with a racist system, writes @DrIbram: https://t.co/GTu7oTFdLe

name: TheAtlantic
text: One of Japan’s most innovative, and least remembered, manga artists was a woman who was unafraid to be a gender outlaw of sorts—both on and off the page. @GabbyBellot on the groundbreaking work of Kuniko Tsurita, translated into English for the first time: https://t.co/O6Kg71E7an

name: TheAtlantic
text: By using various agencies to bolster his "law and order" candidacy, Donald Trump is wrecking the public's trust in government, @PeterAtlantic writes: https://t.co/tX6ytCFxcv
